revised_title: C n.m.r. in Organic Solids: Limits to Spectral Resolution and Molecular Motion
tldr: This article discusses the limitations of spectral resolution and determining molecular motion in solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) experiments, specifically in organic solids. The authors examine rotating frame relaxation and spectral line resolution, exploring the effects of magnetic field strength, sample rotation, and dipolar coupling on the quality of NMR spectra.
